attributes.action: Reopen the Met Police investigation into the ‘UK Cat Killer”
attributes.additional_details: Various animal charities (Cats Protection and SNARL to name but two) are involved in this investigation and utterly contradict the Met Police statement. The injuries sustained by victims doesn’t match the statement issued by the Met Police and this decision seems based more on expediency and financial considerations.  It is a point of history that serial killers often graduate from animals to humans at some point.
attributes.background: The decision by the Met Police to close its investigation into the ‘UK Cat Killer’ is dangerously flawed and ignores the evidence. It also contradicts expert advice and seems based more on expediency and financial considerations than the actual evidence.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise.

This is a decision for the Metropolitan Police. You can find out how to complain about a police decision here:

https://www.met.police.uk/advice/advice-and-information/c/complaints/
